column4: doesn anybody know where the package for flashplugin nonfree of version 10 beta is hanging out? launchpad bugtracker says its been released somewhere by Daniel T Chen...
Try Adobe, they are the ones who released it.
you say the launchpad janitor lies ?
That does not mean that 10 has hit the repositories yet.  That means a bug has been confirmed fixed in 10
Indeed. And having a package version number doesn't imply it's in the main repos.  It will be released eventually.  If you need it now, adobe allows you to download it.
well i say its rather obvious I prefer a packaged version
So what is your question then?  No it is not available yet as is quite obvious by searching the repos and looking at the plugin version.
i assumed it was out somewhere
It is, in the intrepid repositories.  https://code.launchpad.net/ubuntu/intrepid/+source/flashplugin-nonfree/10.0.1.218ubuntu1
ty, thats what i wanted to know and couldn't find using google
You're on hardy I assume?  I'd be surprised if it took very long to show up in the repos.  Fairly popular and high demand package for us end users.
its a beta ;) i'd say soso. flash 9 is a bi*** but 10 is beta
Agreed.  Here's hoping the beta works wonderfully and we can forget about the mess that is/was 9.
the meta-ish package build, but it seems i need to pull updated libflashsupport and libasound2-plugins too
got hardy packags build from the intrepid source-packages. all installed now. thanks for the pointers.
